3903 b.d.binding = binding;
3904 b.d.stage = stage;
3905 b.d.type = BufferLoad;
3906 b.d.u.sbuf.buf = buf;
3907 b.d.u.sbuf.offset = offset;
3908 b.d.u.sbuf.maybeSize = size;
3909 return b;
3910}
3911
3912/*!
3913 \return a shader resource binding for a write-only storage buffer with the
3914 given \a binding number and pipeline \a stage.
3915
3916 \note When \a buf is not null, must have been created with
3917 QRhiBuffer::StorageBuffer.
3918
3919 \note \a buf can be null. It is valid to create a
3920 QRhiShaderResourceBindings with unspecified resources, but such an object
3921 cannot be used with QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources(). It is however
3922 suitable for creating pipelines. Such a pipeline must then always be used
3923 together with another, layout compatible QRhiShaderResourceBindings with
3924 resources present passed to QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources().
3925
3926 \note Buffer load/store is only guaranteed to be available within a compute
3927 pipeline. While some backends may support using these resources in a
3928 graphics pipeline as well, this is not universally supported, and even when
3929 it is, unexpected problems may arise when it comes to barriers and
3930 synchronization. Therefore, avoid using such resources with shaders other
3931 than compute.
3932 */
3933QRhiShaderResourceBinding QRhiShaderResourceBinding::bufferStore(
3934 int binding, StageFlags stage, QRhiBuffer *buf)
3935{
3936 QRhiShaderResourceBinding b;
3937 b.d.binding = binding;
3938 b.d.stage = stage;
3939 b.d.type = BufferStore;
3940 b.d.u.sbuf.buf = buf;
3941 b.d.u.sbuf.offset = 0;
3942 b.d.u.sbuf.maybeSize = 0; // entire buffer
3943 return b;
3944}
3945
3946/*!
3947 \return a shader resource binding for a write-only storage buffer with the
3948 given \a binding number and pipeline \a stage. This overload binds a region
3949 only, as specified by \a offset and \a size.
3950
3951 \note When \a buf is not null, must have been created with
3952 QRhiBuffer::StorageBuffer.
3953
3954 \note \a buf can be null. It is valid to create a
3955 QRhiShaderResourceBindings with unspecified resources, but such an object
3956 cannot be used with QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources(). It is however
3957 suitable for creating pipelines. Such a pipeline must then always be used
3958 together with another, layout compatible QRhiShaderResourceBindings with
3959 resources present passed to QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources().
3960
3961 \note Buffer load/store is only guaranteed to be available within a compute
3962 pipeline. While some backends may support using these resources in a
3963 graphics pipeline as well, this is not universally supported, and even when
3964 it is, unexpected problems may arise when it comes to barriers and
3965 synchronization. Therefore, avoid using such resources with shaders other
3966 than compute.
3967 */
3968QRhiShaderResourceBinding QRhiShaderResourceBinding::bufferStore(
3969 int binding, StageFlags stage, QRhiBuffer *buf, quint32 offset, quint32 size)
3970{
3971 Q_ASSERT(size > 0);
3972 QRhiShaderResourceBinding b;
3973 b.d.binding = binding;
3974 b.d.stage = stage;
3975 b.d.type = BufferStore;
3976 b.d.u.sbuf.buf = buf;
3977 b.d.u.sbuf.offset = offset;
3978 b.d.u.sbuf.maybeSize = size;
3979 return b;
3980}
3981
3982/*!
3983 \return a shader resource binding for a read-write storage buffer with the
3984 given \a binding number and pipeline \a stage.
3985
3986 \note When \a buf is not null, must have been created with
3987 QRhiBuffer::StorageBuffer.
3988
3989 \note \a buf can be null. It is valid to create a
3990 QRhiShaderResourceBindings with unspecified resources, but such an object
3991 cannot be used with QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources(). It is however
3992 suitable for creating pipelines. Such a pipeline must then always be used
3993 together with another, layout compatible QRhiShaderResourceBindings with
3994 resources present passed to QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources().
3995
3996 \note Buffer load/store is only guaranteed to be available within a compute
3997 pipeline. While some backends may support using these resources in a
3998 graphics pipeline as well, this is not universally supported, and even when
3999 it is, unexpected problems may arise when it comes to barriers and
4000 synchronization. Therefore, avoid using such resources with shaders other
4001 than compute.
4002 */
4003QRhiShaderResourceBinding QRhiShaderResourceBinding::bufferLoadStore(
4004 int binding, StageFlags stage, QRhiBuffer *buf)
4005{
4006 QRhiShaderResourceBinding b;
4007 b.d.binding = binding;
4008 b.d.stage = stage;
4009 b.d.type = BufferLoadStore;
4010 b.d.u.sbuf.buf = buf;
4011 b.d.u.sbuf.offset = 0;
4012 b.d.u.sbuf.maybeSize = 0; // entire buffer
4013 return b;
4014}
4015
4016/*!
4017 \return a shader resource binding for a read-write storage buffer with the
4018 given \a binding number and pipeline \a stage. This overload binds a region
4019 only, as specified by \a offset and \a size.
4020
4021 \note When \a buf is not null, must have been created with
4022 QRhiBuffer::StorageBuffer.
4023
4024 \note \a buf can be null. It is valid to create a
4025 QRhiShaderResourceBindings with unspecified resources, but such an object
4026 cannot be used with QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources(). It is however
4027 suitable for creating pipelines. Such a pipeline must then always be used
4028 together with another, layout compatible QRhiShaderResourceBindings with
4029 resources present passed to QRhiCommandBuffer::setShaderResources().
4030
4031 \note Buffer load/store is only guaranteed to be available within a compute
4032 pipeline. While some backends may support using these resources in a
4033 graphics pipeline as well, this is not universally supported, and even when
4034 it is, unexpected problems may arise when it comes to barriers and
4035 synchronization. Therefore, avoid using such resources with shaders other
4036 than compute.
4037 */
4038QRhiShaderResourceBinding QRhiShaderResourceBinding::bufferLoadStore(
4039 int binding, StageFlags stage, QRhiBuffer *buf, quint32 offset, quint32 size)
4040{
4041 Q_ASSERT(size > 0);
4042 QRhiShaderResourceBinding b;
4043 b.d.binding = binding;
4044 b.d.stage = stage;
4045 b.d.type = BufferLoadStore;
4046 b.d.u.sbuf.buf = buf;
4047 b.d.u.sbuf.offset = offset;
4048 b.d.u.sbuf.maybeSize = size;
4049 return b;
4050}
4051
4052/*!
4053 \return \c true if the contents of the two QRhiShaderResourceBinding
4054 objects \a a and \a b are equal. This includes the resources (buffer,
4055 texture) and related parameters (offset, size) as well. To only compare
4056 layouts (binding point, pipeline stage, resource type), use
4057 \l{QRhiShaderResourceBinding::isLayoutCompatible()}{isLayoutCompatible()}
4058 instead.
4059
4060 \relates QRhiShaderResourceBinding
4061 */
4062bool operator==(const QRhiShaderResourceBinding &a, const QRhiShaderResourceBinding &b) noexcept
4063{
4064 const QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Data *da = a.data();
4065 const QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Data *db = b.data();
4066
4067 if (da == db)
4068 return true;
4069
4070
4071 if (da->binding != db->binding
4072 || da->stage != db->stage
4073 || da->type != db->type)
4074 {
4075 return false;
4076 }
4077
4078 switch (da->type) {
4079 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::UniformBuffer:
4080 if (da->u.ubuf.buf != db->u.ubuf.buf
4081 || da->u.ubuf.offset != db->u.ubuf.offset
4082 || da->u.ubuf.maybeSize != db->u.ubuf.maybeSize)
4083 {
4084 return false;
4085 }
4086 break;
4087 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::SampledTexture:
4088 if (da->u.stex.count != db->u.stex.count)
4089 return false;
4090 for (int i = 0; i < da->u.stex.count; ++i) {
4091 if (da->u.stex.texSamplers[i].tex != db->u.stex.texSamplers[i].tex
4092 || da->u.stex.texSamplers[i].sampler != db->u.stex.texSamplers[i].sampler)
4093 {
4094 return false;
4095 }
4096 }
4097 break;
4098 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Texture:
4099 if (da->u.stex.count != db->u.stex.count)
4100 return false;
4101 for (int i = 0; i < da->u.stex.count; ++i) {
4102 if (da->u.stex.texSamplers[i].tex != db->u.stex.texSamplers[i].tex)
4103 return false;
4104 }
4105 break;
4106 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Sampler:
4107 if (da->u.stex.texSamplers[0].sampler != db->u.stex.texSamplers[0].sampler)
4108 return false;
4109 break;
4110 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoad:
4111 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageStore:
4112 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoadStore:
4113 if (da->u.simage.tex != db->u.simage.tex
4114 || da->u.simage.level != db->u.simage.level)
4115 {
4116 return false;
4117 }
4118 break;
4119 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoad:
4120 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferStore:
4121 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoadStore:
4122 if (da->u.sbuf.buf != db->u.sbuf.buf
4123 || da->u.sbuf.offset != db->u.sbuf.offset
4124 || da->u.sbuf.maybeSize != db->u.sbuf.maybeSize)
4125 {
4126 return false;
4127 }
4128 break;
4129 default:
4130 Q_UNREACHABLE_RETURN(false);
4131 }
4132
4133 return true;
4134}
4135
4136/*!
4137 \return \c false if all the bindings in the two QRhiShaderResourceBinding
4138 objects \a a and \a b are equal; otherwise returns \c true.
4139
4140 \relates QRhiShaderResourceBinding
4141 */
4142bool operator!=(const QRhiShaderResourceBinding &a, const QRhiShaderResourceBinding &b) noexcept
4143{
4144 return !(a == b);
4145}
4146
4147/*!
4148 \return the hash value for \a b, using \a seed to seed the calculation.
4149
4150 \relates QRhiShaderResourceBinding
4151 */
4152size_t qHash(const QRhiShaderResourceBinding &b, size_t seed) noexcept
4153{
4154 const QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Data *d = b.data();
4155 size_t h = uint(d->binding) ^ uint(d->stage) ^ uint(d->type) ^ seed;
4156 switch (d->type) {
4157 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::UniformBuffer:
4158 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.ubuf.buf));
4159 break;
4160 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::SampledTexture:
4161 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.stex.texSamplers[0].tex));
4162 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.stex.texSamplers[0].sampler));
4163 break;
4164 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Texture:
4165 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.stex.texSamplers[0].tex));
4166 break;
4167 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Sampler:
4168 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.stex.texSamplers[0].sampler));
4169 break;
4170 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoad:
4171 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageStore:
4172 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoadStore:
4173 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.simage.tex));
4174 break;
4175 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoad:
4176 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferStore:
4177 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoadStore:
4178 h ^= qHash(key: reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(d->u.sbuf.buf));
4179 break;
4180 }
4181 return h;
4182}
4183
4184#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
4185QDebug operator<<(QDebug dbg, const QRhiShaderResourceBinding &b)
4186{
4187 QDebugStateSaver saver(dbg);
4188 const QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Data *d = b.data();
4189 dbg.nospace() << "QRhiShaderResourceBinding("
4190 << "binding=" << d->binding
4191 << " stage=" << d->stage
4192 << " type=" << d->type;
4193 switch (d->type) {
4194 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::UniformBuffer:
4195 dbg.nospace() << " UniformBuffer("
4196 << "buffer=" << d->u.ubuf.buf
4197 << " offset=" << d->u.ubuf.offset
4198 << " maybeSize=" << d->u.ubuf.maybeSize
4199 << ')';
4200 break;
4201 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::SampledTexture:
4202 dbg.nospace() << " SampledTextures("
4203 << "count=" << d->u.stex.count;
4204 for (int i = 0; i < d->u.stex.count; ++i) {
4205 dbg.nospace() << " texture=" << d->u.stex.texSamplers[i].tex
4206 << " sampler=" << d->u.stex.texSamplers[i].sampler;
4207 }
4208 dbg.nospace() << ')';
4209 break;
4210 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Texture:
4211 dbg.nospace() << " Textures("
4212 << "count=" << d->u.stex.count;
4213 for (int i = 0; i < d->u.stex.count; ++i)
4214 dbg.nospace() << " texture=" << d->u.stex.texSamplers[i].tex;
4215 dbg.nospace() << ')';
4216 break;
4217 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Sampler:
4218 dbg.nospace() << " Sampler("
4219 << " sampler=" << d->u.stex.texSamplers[0].sampler
4220 << ')';
4221 break;
4222 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoad:
4223 dbg.nospace() << " ImageLoad("
4224 << "texture=" << d->u.simage.tex
4225 << " level=" << d->u.simage.level
4226 << ')';
4227 break;
4228 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageStore:
4229 dbg.nospace() << " ImageStore("
4230 << "texture=" << d->u.simage.tex
4231 << " level=" << d->u.simage.level
4232 << ')';
4233 break;
4234 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoadStore:
4235 dbg.nospace() << " ImageLoadStore("
4236 << "texture=" << d->u.simage.tex
4237 << " level=" << d->u.simage.level
4238 << ')';
4239 break;
4240 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoad:
4241 dbg.nospace() << " BufferLoad("
4242 << "buffer=" << d->u.sbuf.buf
4243 << " offset=" << d->u.sbuf.offset
4244 << " maybeSize=" << d->u.sbuf.maybeSize
4245 << ')';
4246 break;
4247 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferStore:
4248 dbg.nospace() << " BufferStore("
4249 << "buffer=" << d->u.sbuf.buf
4250 << " offset=" << d->u.sbuf.offset
4251 << " maybeSize=" << d->u.sbuf.maybeSize
4252 << ')';
4253 break;
4254 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoadStore:
4255 dbg.nospace() << " BufferLoadStore("
4256 << "buffer=" << d->u.sbuf.buf
4257 << " offset=" << d->u.sbuf.offset
4258 << " maybeSize=" << d->u.sbuf.maybeSize
4259 << ')';
4260 break;
4261 default:
4262 dbg.nospace() << " UNKNOWN()";
4263 break;
4264 }
4265 dbg.nospace() << ')';
4266 return dbg;
4267}
4268#endif
4269
4270#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
4271QDebug operator<<(QDebug dbg, const QRhiShaderResourceBindings &srb)
4272{
4273 QDebugStateSaver saver(dbg);
4274 dbg.nospace() << "QRhiShaderResourceBindings("
4275 << srb.m_bindings
4276 << ')';
4277 return dbg;
4278}
4279#endif
4280
4281/*!
4282 \class QRhiGraphicsPipeline
4283 \internal
4284 \inmodule QtGui
4285 \brief Graphics pipeline state resource.
4286
4287 \note Setting the shader stages is mandatory. There must be at least one
4288 stage, and there must be a vertex stage.
4289
4290 \note Setting the shader resource bindings is mandatory. The referenced
4291 QRhiShaderResourceBindings must already have create() called on it by the
4292 time create() is called. Associating with a QRhiShaderResourceBindings that
4293 has no bindings is also valid, as long as no shader in any stage expects
4294 any resources.
4295
4296 \note Setting the render pass descriptor is mandatory. To obtain a
4297 QRhiRenderPassDescriptor that can be passed to setRenderPassDescriptor(),
4298 use either QRhiTextureRenderTarget::newCompatibleRenderPassDescriptor() or
4299 QRhiSwapChain::newCompatibleRenderPassDescriptor().
4300
4301 \note Setting the vertex input layout is mandatory.
4302
4303 \note sampleCount() defaults to 1 and must match the sample count of the
4304 render target's color and depth stencil attachments.
4305
4306 \note The depth test, depth write, and stencil test are disabled by
4307 default.
4308
4309 \note stencilReadMask() and stencilWriteMask() apply to both faces. They
4310 both default to 0xFF.
4311 */
4312
4313/*!
4314 \fn void QRhiGraphicsPipeline::setTargetBlends(const QList<TargetBlend> &blends)
4315
4316 Sets the blend specification for color attachments. Each element in \a
4317 blends corresponds to a color attachment of the render target.
4318
4319 By default no blends are set, which is a shortcut to disabling blending and
4320 enabling color write for all four channels.
4321 */
4322
4323/*!
4324 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::Flag
4325
4326 Flag values for describing the dynamic state of the pipeline, and other
4327 options. The viewport is always dynamic.
4328
4329 \value UsesBlendConstants Indicates that a blend color constant will be set
4330 via QRhiCommandBuffer::setBlendConstants()
4331
4332 \value UsesStencilRef Indicates that a stencil reference value will be set
4333 via QRhiCommandBuffer::setStencilRef()
4334
4335 \value UsesScissor Indicates that a scissor rectangle will be set via
4336 QRhiCommandBuffer::setScissor()
4337
4338 \value CompileShadersWithDebugInfo Requests compiling shaders with debug
4339 information enabled. This is relevant only when runtime shader compilation
4340 from source code is involved, and only when the underlying infrastructure
4341 supports this. With concrete examples, this is not relevant with Vulkan and
4342 SPIR-V, because the GLSL-to-SPIR-V compilation does not happen at run
4343 time. On the other hand, consider Direct3D and HLSL, where there are
4344 multiple options: when the QShader packages ship with pre-compiled bytecode
4345 (\c DXBC), debug information is to be requested through the tool that
4346 generates the \c{.qsb} file, similarly to the case of Vulkan and
4347 SPIR-V. However, when having HLSL source code in the pre- or
4348 runtime-generated QShader packages, the first phase of compilation (HLSL
4349 source to intermediate format) happens at run time too, with this flag taken
4350 into account. Debug information is relevant in particular with tools like
4351 RenderDoc since it allows seeing the original source code when investigating
4352 the pipeline and when performing vertex or fragment shader debugging.
4353 */
4354
4355/*!
4356 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::Topology
4357 Specifies the primitive topology
4358
4359 \value Triangles (default)
4360 \value TriangleStrip
4361 \value TriangleFan (only available if QRhi::TriangleFanTopology is supported)
4362 \value Lines
4363 \value LineStrip
4364 \value Points
4365
4366 \value Patches (only available if QRhi::Tessellation is supported, and
4367 requires the tessellation stages to be present in the pipeline)
4368 */
4369
4370/*!
4371 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::CullMode
4372 Specifies the culling mode
4373
4374 \value None No culling (default)
4375 \value Front Cull front faces
4376 \value Back Cull back faces
4377 */
4378
4379/*!
4380 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::FrontFace
4381 Specifies the front face winding order
4382
4383 \value CCW Counter clockwise (default)
4384 \value CW Clockwise
4385 */
4386
4387/*!
4388 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::ColorMaskComponent
4389 Flag values for specifying the color write mask
4390
4391 \value R
4392 \value G
4393 \value B
4394 \value A
4395 */
4396
4397/*!
4398 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::BlendFactor
4399 Specifies the blend factor
4400
4401 \value Zero
4402 \value One
4403 \value SrcColor
4404 \value OneMinusSrcColor
4405 \value DstColor
4406 \value OneMinusDstColor
4407 \value SrcAlpha
4408 \value OneMinusSrcAlpha
4409 \value DstAlpha
4410 \value OneMinusDstAlpha
4411 \value ConstantColor
4412 \value OneMinusConstantColor
4413 \value ConstantAlpha
4414 \value OneMinusConstantAlpha
4415 \value SrcAlphaSaturate
4416 \value Src1Color
4417 \value OneMinusSrc1Color
4418 \value Src1Alpha
4419 \value OneMinusSrc1Alpha
4420 */
4421
4422/*!
4423 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::BlendOp
4424 Specifies the blend operation
4425
4426 \value Add
4427 \value Subtract
4428 \value ReverseSubtract
4429 \value Min
4430 \value Max
4431 */
4432
4433/*!
4434 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::CompareOp
4435 Specifies the depth or stencil comparison function
4436
4437 \value Never
4438 \value Less (default for depth)
4439 \value Equal
4440 \value LessOrEqual
4441 \value Greater
4442 \value NotEqual
4443 \value GreaterOrEqual
4444 \value Always (default for stencil)
4445 */
4446
4447/*!
4448 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::StencilOp
4449 Specifies the stencil operation
4450
4451 \value StencilZero
4452 \value Keep (default)
4453 \value Replace
4454 \value IncrementAndClamp
4455 \value DecrementAndClamp
4456 \value Invert
4457 \value IncrementAndWrap
4458 \value DecrementAndWrap
4459 */
4460
4461/*!
4462 \enum QRhiGraphicsPipeline::PolygonMode
4463 \brief Specifies the polygon rasterization mode
4464
4465 Polygon Mode (Triangle Fill Mode in Metal, Fill Mode in D3D) specifies
4466 the fill mode used when rasterizing polygons. Polygons may be drawn as
4467 solids (Fill), or as a wire mesh (Line).
4468
4469 Support for non-fill polygon modes is optional and is indicated by the
4470 QRhi::NonFillPolygonMode feature. With OpenGL ES and some Vulkan
4471 implementations the feature will likely be reported as unsupported, which
4472 then means values other than Fill cannot be used.
4473
4474 \value Fill The interior of the polygon is filled (default)
4475 \value Line Boundary edges of the polygon are drawn as line segments.
4476 */
4477
4478/*!
4479 \class QRhiGraphicsPipeline::TargetBlend
4480 \internal
4481 \inmodule QtGui
4482 \brief Describes the blend state for one color attachment.
4483
4484 Defaults to color write enabled, blending disabled. The blend values are
4485 set up for pre-multiplied alpha (One, OneMinusSrcAlpha, One,
4486 OneMinusSrcAlpha) by default.
4487 */
4488
4489/*!
4490 \class QRhiGraphicsPipeline::StencilOpState
4491 \internal
4492 \inmodule QtGui
4493 \brief Describes the stencil operation state.
4494 */
4495
4496/*!
4497 \internal
4498 */
4499QRhiGraphicsPipeline::QRhiGraphicsPipeline(QRhiImplementation *rhi)
4500 : QRhiResource(rhi)
4501{
4502}
4503
4504/*!
4505 \return the resource type.
4506 */
4507QRhiResource::Type QRhiGraphicsPipeline::resourceType() const
4508{
4509 return GraphicsPipeline;
4510}
4511
4512/*!
4513 \fn bool QRhiGraphicsPipeline::create()
4514
4515 Creates the corresponding native graphics resources. If there are already
4516 resources present due to an earlier create() with no corresponding
4517 destroy(), then destroy() is called implicitly first.
4518
4519 \return \c true when successful, \c false when a graphics operation failed.
4520 Regardless of the return value, calling destroy() is always safe.
4521 */
4522
4523/*!
4524 \fn void QRhiGraphicsPipeline::setDepthTest(bool enable)
4525
4526 Enables or disables depth testing. Both depth test and the writing out of
4527 depth data are disabled by default.
4528
4529 \sa setDepthWrite()
4530 */
4531
4532/*!
4533 \fn void QRhiGraphicsPipeline::setDepthWrite(bool enable)
4534
4535 Controls the writing out of depth data into the depth buffer. By default
4536 this is disabled. Depth write is typically enabled together with the depth
4537 test.
4538
4539 \note Enabling depth write without having depth testing enabled may not
4540 lead to the desired result, and should be avoided.
4541
4542 \sa setDepthTest()
4543 */
4544
4545/*!
4546 \class QRhiSwapChain
4547 \internal
4548 \inmodule QtGui
4549 \brief Swapchain resource.
4550
4551 A swapchain enables presenting rendering results to a surface. A swapchain
4552 is typically backed by a set of color buffers. Of these, one is displayed
4553 at a time.
4554
4555 Below is a typical pattern for creating and managing a swapchain and some
4556 associated resources in order to render onto a QWindow:
4557
4558 \badcode
4559 void init()
4560 {
4561 sc = rhi->newSwapChain();
4562 ds = rhi->newRenderBuffer(QRhiRenderBuffer::DepthStencil,
4563 QSize(), // no need to set the size here due to UsedWithSwapChainOnly
4564 1,
4565 QRhiRenderBuffer::UsedWithSwapChainOnly);
4566 sc->setWindow(window);
4567 sc->setDepthStencil(ds);
4568 rp = sc->newCompatibleRenderPassDescriptor();
4569 sc->setRenderPassDescriptor(rp);
4570 resizeSwapChain();
4571 }
4572
4573 void resizeSwapChain()
4574 {
4575 hasSwapChain = sc->createOrResize();
4576 }
4577
4578 void render()
4579 {
4580 if (!hasSwapChain || notExposed)
4581 return;
4582
4583 if (sc->currentPixelSize() != sc->surfacePixelSize() || newlyExposed) {
4584 resizeSwapChain();
4585 if (!hasSwapChain)
4586 return;
4587 newlyExposed = false;
4588 }
4589
4590 rhi->beginFrame(sc);
4591 // ...
4592 rhi->endFrame(sc);
4593 }
4594 \endcode
4595
4596 Avoid relying on QWindow resize events to resize swapchains, especially
4597 considering that surface sizes may not always fully match the QWindow
4598 reported dimensions. The safe, cross-platform approach is to do the check
4599 via surfacePixelSize() whenever starting a new frame.
4600
4601 Releasing the swapchain must happen while the QWindow and the underlying
4602 native window is fully up and running. Building on the previous example:
4603
4604 \badcode
4605 void releaseSwapChain()
4606 {
4607 if (hasSwapChain) {
4608 sc->destroy();
4609 hasSwapChain = false;
4610 }
4611 }
4612
4613 // assuming Window is our QWindow subclass
4614 bool Window::event(QEvent *e)
4615 {
4616 switch (e->type()) {
4617 case QEvent::UpdateRequest: // for QWindow::requestUpdate()
4618 render();
4619 break;
4620 case QEvent::PlatformSurface:
4621 if (static_cast<QPlatformSurfaceEvent *>(e)->surfaceEventType() == QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceAboutToBeDestroyed)
4622 releaseSwapChain();
4623 break;
4624 default:
4625 break;
4626 }
4627 return QWindow::event(e);
4628 }
4629 \endcode
4630
4631 Initializing the swapchain and starting to render the first frame cannot
4632 start at any time. The safe, cross-platform approach is to rely on expose
4633 events. QExposeEvent is a loosely specified event that is sent whenever a
4634 window gets mapped, obscured, and resized, depending on the platform.
4635
4636 \badcode
4637 void Window::exposeEvent(QExposeEvent *)
4638 {
4639 // initialize and start rendering when the window becomes usable for graphics purposes
4640 if (isExposed() && !running) {
4641 running = true;
4642 init();
4643 }
4644
4645 // stop pushing frames when not exposed or size becomes 0
4646 if ((!isExposed() || (hasSwapChain && sc->surfacePixelSize().isEmpty())) && running)
4647 notExposed = true;
4648
4649 // continue when exposed again and the surface has a valid size
4650 if (isExposed() && running && notExposed && !sc->surfacePixelSize().isEmpty()) {
4651 notExposed = false;
4652 newlyExposed = true;
4653 }
4654
4655 if (isExposed() && !sc->surfacePixelSize().isEmpty())
4656 render();
4657 }
4658 \endcode
4659
4660 Once the rendering has started, a simple way to request a new frame is
4661 QWindow::requestUpdate(). While on some platforms this is merely a small
4662 timer, on others it has a specific implementation: for instance on macOS or
4663 iOS it may be backed by
4664 \l{https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corevideo/cvdisplaylink?language=objc}{CVDisplayLink}.
4665 The example above is already prepared for update requests by handling
4666 QEvent::UpdateRequest.
4667
4668 While acting as a QRhiRenderTarget, QRhiSwapChain also manages a
4669 QRhiCommandBuffer. Calling QRhi::endFrame() submits the recorded commands
4670 and also enqueues a \c present request. The default behavior is to do this
4671 with a swap interval of 1, meaning synchronizing to the display's vertical
4672 refresh is enabled. Thus the rendering thread calling beginFrame() and
4673 endFrame() will get throttled to vsync. On some backends this can be
4674 disabled by passing QRhiSwapChain:NoVSync in flags().
4675
4676 Multisampling (MSAA) is handled transparently to the applications when
4677 requested via setSampleCount(). Where applicable, QRhiSwapChain will take
4678 care of creating additional color buffers and issuing a multisample resolve
4679 command at the end of a frame. For OpenGL, it is necessary to request the
4680 appropriate sample count also via QSurfaceFormat, by calling
4681 QSurfaceFormat::setDefaultFormat() before initializing the QRhi.
4682 */
4683
4684/*!
4685 \enum QRhiSwapChain::Flag
4686 Flag values to describe swapchain properties
4687
4688 \value SurfaceHasPreMulAlpha Indicates that the target surface has
4689 transparency with premultiplied alpha. For example, this is what Qt Quick
4690 uses when the alpha channel is enabled on the target QWindow, because the
4691 scenegraph rendrerer always outputs fragments with alpha multiplied into
4692 the red, green, and blue values. To ensure identical behavior across
4693 platforms, always set QSurfaceFormat::alphaBufferSize() to a non-zero value
4694 on the target QWindow whenever this flag is set on the swapchain.
4695
4696 \value SurfaceHasNonPreMulAlpha Indicates the target surface has
4697 transparency with non-premultiplied alpha. Be aware that this may not be
4698 supported on some systems, if the system compositor always expects content
4699 with premultiplied alpha. In that case the behavior with this flag set is
4700 expected to be equivalent to SurfaceHasPreMulAlpha.
4701
4702 \value sRGB Requests to pick an sRGB format for the swapchain's color
4703 buffers and/or render target views, where applicable. Note that this
4704 implies that sRGB framebuffer update and blending will get enabled for all
4705 content targeting this swapchain, and opting out is not possible. For
4706 OpenGL, set \l{QSurfaceFormat::sRGBColorSpace}{sRGBColorSpace} on the
4707 QSurfaceFormat of the QWindow in addition. Applicable only when the
4708 swapchain format is set to QRhiSwapChain::SDR.
4709
4710 \value UsedAsTransferSource Indicates the swapchain will be used as the
4711 source of a readback in QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::readBackTexture().
4712
4713 \value NoVSync Requests disabling waiting for vertical sync, also avoiding
4714 throttling the rendering thread. The behavior is backend specific and
4715 applicable only where it is possible to control this. Some may ignore the
4716 request altogether. For OpenGL, try instead setting the swap interval to 0
4717 on the QWindow via QSurfaceFormat::setSwapInterval().
4718
4719 \value MinimalBufferCount Requests creating the swapchain with the minimum
4720 number of buffers, which is in practice 2, unless the graphics
4721 implementation has a higher minimum number than that. Only applicable with
4722 backends where such control is available via the graphics API, for example,
4723 Vulkan. By default it is up to the backend to decide what number of buffers
4724 it requests (in practice this is almost always either 2 or 3), and it is
4725 not the applications' concern. However, on Vulkan for instance the backend
4726 will likely prefer the higher number (3), for example to avoid odd
4727 performance issues with some Vulkan implementations on mobile devices. It
4728 could be that on some platforms it can prove to be beneficial to force the
4729 lower buffer count (2), so this flag allows forcing that. Note that all
4730 this has no effect on the number of frames kept in flight, so the CPU
4731 (QRhi) will still prepare frames at most \c{N - 1} frames ahead of the GPU,
4732 even when the swapchain image buffer count larger than \c N. (\c{N} =
4733 QRhi::FramesInFlight and typically 2).
4734 */
4735
4736/*!
4737 \enum QRhiSwapChain::Format
4738 Describes the swapchain format. The default format is SDR.
4739
4740 \value SDR 8-bit RGBA or BGRA, depending on the backend and platform. With
4741 OpenGL ES in particular, it could happen that the platform provides less
4742 than 8 bits (e.g. due to EGL and the QSurfaceFormat choosing a 565 or 444
4743 format - this is outside the control of QRhi). Standard dynamic range. May
4744 be combined with setting the QRhiSwapChain::sRGB flag.
4745
4746 \value HDRExtendedSrgbLinear 16-bit float RGBA, high dynamic range,
4747 extended linear sRGB (scRGB) color space. This involves Rec. 709 primaries
4748 (same as SDR/sRGB) and linear colors. Conversion to the display's native
4749 color space (such as, HDR10) is performed by the windowing system. On
4750 Windows this is the canonical color space of the system compositor, and is
4751 the recommended format for HDR swapchains in general.
4752
4753 \value HDR10 10-bit unsigned int RGB or BGR with 2 bit alpha, high dynamic
4754 range, HDR10 (Rec. 2020) color space with an ST2084 PQ transfer function.
4755 */
4756
4757/*!
4758 \internal
4759 */
4760QRhiSwapChain::QRhiSwapChain(QRhiImplementation *rhi)
4761 : QRhiResource(rhi)
4762{
4763}
4764
4765/*!
4766 \return the resource type.
4767 */
4768QRhiResource::Type QRhiSwapChain::resourceType() const
4769{
4770 return SwapChain;
4771}
4772
4773/*!
4774 \fn QSize QRhiSwapChain::currentPixelSize() const
4775
4776 \return the size with which the swapchain was last successfully built. Use
4777 this to decide if createOrResize() needs to be called again: if
4778 \c{currentPixelSize() != surfacePixelSize()} then the swapchain needs to be
4779 resized.
4780
4781 \note Typical rendering logic will call this function to get the output
4782 size when starting to prepare a new frame, and base dependent calculations
4783 (such as, the viewport) on the size returned from this function.
4784
4785 While in many cases the value is the same as \c{QWindow::size() *
4786 QWindow::devicePixelRatio()}, relying on the QWindow-reported size is not
4787 guaranteed to be correct on all platforms and graphics API implementations.
4788 Using this function is therefore strongly recommended whenever there is a
4789 need to identify the dimensions, in pixels, of the output layer or surface.
4790
4791 This also has the added benefit of avoiding potential data races when QRhi
4792 is used on a dedicated rendering thread, because the need to call QWindow
4793 functions, that may then access data updated on the main thread, is
4794 avoided.
4795
4796 \sa surfacePixelSize()
4797 */
4798
4799/*!
4800 \fn QSize QRhiSwapChain::surfacePixelSize()
4801
4802 \return The size of the window's associated surface or layer.
4803
4804 \warning Do not assume this is the same as \c{QWindow::size() *
4805 QWindow::devicePixelRatio()}. With some graphics APIs and windowing system
4806 interfaces (for example, Vulkan) there is a theoretical possibility for a
4807 surface to assume a size different from the associated window. To support
4808 these cases, rendering logic must always base size-derived calculations
4809 (such as, viewports) on the size reported from QRhiSwapChain, and never on
4810 the size queried from QWindow.
4811
4812 \note Can also be called before createOrResize(), if at least window() is
4813 already set) This in combination with currentPixelSize() allows to detect
4814 when a swapchain needs to be resized. However, watch out for the fact that
4815 the size of the underlying native object (surface, layer, or similar) is
4816 "live", so whenever this function is called, it returns the latest value
4817 reported by the underlying implementation, without any atomicity guarantee.
4818 Therefore, using this function to determine pixel sizes for graphics
4819 resources that are used in a frame is strongly discouraged. Rely on
4820 currentPixelSize() instead which returns a size that is atomic and will not
4821 change between createOrResize() invocations.
4822
4823 \note For depth-stencil buffers used in combination with the swapchain's
4824 color buffers, it is strongly recommended to rely on the automatic sizing
4825 and rebuilding behavior provided by the
4826 QRhiRenderBuffer:UsedWithSwapChainOnly flag. Avoid querying the surface
4827 size via this function just to get a size that can be passed to
4828 QRhiRenderBuffer::setPixelSize() as that would suffer from the lack of
4829 atomicity as described above.
4830
4831 \sa currentPixelSize()
4832 */
4833
4834/*!
4835 \fn bool QRhiSwapChain::isFormatSuported(Format f)
4836
4837 \return true if the given swapchain format is supported. SDR is always
4838 supported.
4839
4840 \note Can be called independently of createOrResize(), but window() must
4841 already be set. Calling without the window set may lead to unexpected
4842 results depending on the backend and platform (most likely false for any
4843 HDR format), because HDR format support is usually tied to the output
4844 (screen) to which the swapchain's associated window belongs at any given
4845 time. If the result is true for a HDR format, then creating the swapchain
4846 with that format is expected to succeed as long as the window is not moved
4847 to another screen in the meantime.
4848 */
4849
4850/*!
4851 \fn QRhiCommandBuffer *QRhiSwapChain::currentFrameCommandBuffer()
4852
4853 \return a command buffer on which rendering commands can be recorded. Only
4854 valid within a QRhi::beginFrame() - QRhi::endFrame() block where
4855 beginFrame() was called with this swapchain.
4856
4857 \note the value must not be cached and reused between frames
4858*/
4859
4860/*!
4861 \fn QRhiRenderTarget *QRhiSwapChain::currentFrameRenderTarget()
4862
4863 \return a render target that can used with beginPass() in order to render
4864 the swapchain's current backbuffer. Only valid within a
4865 QRhi::beginFrame() - QRhi::endFrame() block where beginFrame() was called
4866 with this swapchain.
4867
4868 \note the value must not be cached and reused between frames
4869 */
4870
4871/*!
4872 \enum QRhiSwapChain::StereoTargetBuffer
4873 Selects the backbuffer to use with a stereoscopic swapchain.
4874
4875 \value LeftBuffer
4876 \value RightBuffer
4877 */
4878
4879/*!
4880 \return a render target that can be used with beginPass() in order to
4881 render to the swapchain's left or right backbuffer. This overload should be
4882 used only with stereoscopic rendering, that is, when the associated QWindow
4883 is backed by two color buffers, one for each eye, instead of just one.
4884
4885 When stereoscopic rendering is not supported, the return value will be
4886 the default target. For the time being the only backend and 3D API where traditional
4887 stereoscopic rendering is supported is OpenGL (excluding OpenGL ES), in
4888 combination with \l QSurfaceFormat::StereoBuffers, assuming it is supported
4889 by the graphics and display driver stack at run time. All other backends
4890 are going to return the default render target from this overload.
4891
4892 \note the value must not be cached and reused between frames
4893 */
4894QRhiRenderTarget *QRhiSwapChain::currentFrameRenderTarget(StereoTargetBuffer targetBuffer)
4895{
4896 Q_UNUSED(targetBuffer);
4897 return currentFrameRenderTarget();
4898}
4899
4900/*!
4901 \fn bool QRhiSwapChain::createOrResize()
4902
4903 Creates the swapchain if not already done and resizes the swapchain buffers
4904 to match the current size of the targeted surface. Call this whenever the
4905 size of the target surface is different than before.
4906
4907 \note call destroy() only when the swapchain needs to be released
4908 completely, typically upon
4909 QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceAboutToBeDestroyed. To perform resizing, just
4910 call createOrResize().
4911
4912 \return \c true when successful, \c false when a graphics operation failed.
4913 Regardless of the return value, calling destroy() is always safe.
4914 */
4915
4916/*!
4917 \struct QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo
4918 \internal
4919 \inmodule QtGui
4920
4921 \brief Describes the high dynamic range related information of the
4922 swapchain's associated output.
4923
4924 To perform tonemapping, one often needs to know the maximum luminance of
4925 the display the swapchain's window is associated with. While this is often
4926 made user-configurable, it can be highly useful to set defaults based on
4927 the values reported by the display itself, thus providing a decent starting
4928 point.
4929
4930 There are some problems however: the information is exposed in different
4931 forms on different platforms, whereas with cross-platform graphics APIs
4932 there is often no associated solution at all, because managing such
4933 information is not in the scope of the API (and may rather be retrievable
4934 via other platform-specific means, if any).
4935
4936 The struct returned from QRhiSwapChain::hdrInfo() contains either some
4937 hard-coded defaults, indicated by the \c isHardCodedDefaults field, or real
4938 values received from an API such as DXGI (IDXGIOutput6) or Cocoa
4939 (NSScreen). The default is 1000 nits for maximum luminance.
4940
4941 With Metal on macOS/iOS, there is no luminance values exposed in the
4942 platform APIs. Instead, the maximum color component value, that would be
4943 1.0 in a non-HDR setup, is provided. The \c limitsType field indicates what
4944 kind of information is available. It is then up to the clients of QRhi to
4945 access the correct data from the \c limits union and use it as they see
4946 fit.
4947
4948 With an API like Vulkan, where there is no way to get such information, the
4949 values are always the built-in defaults and \c isHardCodedDefaults is
4950 always true.
4951
4952 \sa QRhiSwapChain::hdrInfo()
4953 */
4954
4955/*!
4956 \return the HDR information for the associated display.
4957
4958 The returned struct is always the default one if createOrResize() has not
4959 been successfully called yet.
4960
4961 \note What happens when moving a window with an initialized swapchain
4962 between displays (HDR to HDR with different characteristics, HDR to SDR,
4963 etc.) is not currently well-defined and depends heavily on the windowing
4964 system and compositor, with potentially varying behavior between platforms.
4965 Currently QRhi only guarantees that hdrInfo() returns valid data, if
4966 available, for the display to which the swapchain's associated window
4967 belonged at the time of createOrResize().
4968
4969 \sa QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo
4970 */
4971QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo QRhiSwapChain::hdrInfo()
4972{
4973 QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo info;
4974 info.isHardCodedDefaults = true;
4975 info.limitsType = QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo::LuminanceInNits;
4976 info.limits.luminanceInNits.minLuminance = 0.0f;
4977 info.limits.luminanceInNits.maxLuminance = 1000.0f;
4978 return info;
4979}
4980
4981#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
4982QDebug operator<<(QDebug dbg, const QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo &info)
4983{
4984 QDebugStateSaver saver(dbg);
4985 dbg.nospace() << "QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo(" << (info.isHardCodedDefaults ? "with hard-coded defaults" : "queried from system");
4986 switch (info.limitsType) {
4987 case QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo::LuminanceInNits:
4988 dbg.nospace() << " minLuminance=" << info.limits.luminanceInNits.minLuminance
4989 << " maxLuminance=" << info.limits.luminanceInNits.maxLuminance;
4990 break;
4991 case QRhiSwapChainHdrInfo::ColorComponentValue:
4992 dbg.nospace() << " maxColorComponentValue=" << info.limits.colorComponentValue.maxColorComponentValue;
4993 break;
4994 }
4995 dbg.nospace() << ')';
4996 return dbg;
4997}
4998#endif
4999
5000/*!
5001 \class QRhiComputePipeline
5002 \internal
5003 \inmodule QtGui
5004 \brief Compute pipeline state resource.
5005
5006 \note Setting the shader resource bindings is mandatory. The referenced
5007 QRhiShaderResourceBindings must already have created() called on it by the
5008 time create() is called.
5009
5010 \note Setting the shader is mandatory.
5011 */
5012
5013/*!
5014 \enum QRhiComputePipeline::Flag
5015
5016 Flag values for describing pipeline options.
5017
5018 \value CompileShadersWithDebugInfo Requests compiling shaders with debug
5019 information enabled, when applicable. See
5020 QRhiGraphicsPipeline::CompileShadersWithDebugInfo for more information.
5021 */
5022
5023/*!
5024 \return the resource type.
5025 */
5026QRhiResource::Type QRhiComputePipeline::resourceType() const
5027{
5028 return ComputePipeline;
5029}
5030
5031/*!
5032 \internal
5033 */
5034QRhiComputePipeline::QRhiComputePipeline(QRhiImplementation *rhi)
5035 : QRhiResource(rhi)
5036{
5037}
5038
5039/*!
5040 \class QRhiCommandBuffer
5041 \internal
5042 \inmodule QtGui
5043 \brief Command buffer resource.
5044
5045 Not creatable by applications at the moment. The only ways to obtain a
5046 valid QRhiCommandBuffer are to get it from the targeted swapchain via
5047 QRhiSwapChain::currentFrameCommandBuffer(), or, in case of rendering
5048 completely offscreen, initializing one via QRhi::beginOffscreenFrame().
5049 */
5050
5051/*!
5052 \enum QRhiCommandBuffer::IndexFormat
5053 Specifies the index data type
5054
5055 \value IndexUInt16 Unsigned 16-bit (quint16)
5056 \value IndexUInt32 Unsigned 32-bit (quint32)
5057 */
5058
5059/*!
5060 \enum QRhiCommandBuffer::BeginPassFlag
5061 Flag values for QRhi::beginPass()
5062
5063 \value ExternalContent Specifies that there will be a call to
5064 QRhiCommandBuffer::beginExternal() in this pass. Some backends, Vulkan in
5065 particular, will fail if this flag is not set and beginExternal() is still
5066 called.
5067
5068 \value DoNotTrackResourcesForCompute Specifies that there is no need to
5069 track resources used in this pass if the only purpose of such tracking is
5070 to generate barriers for compute. Implies that there are no compute passes
5071 in the frame. This is an optimization hint that may be taken into account
5072 by certain backends, OpenGL in particular, allowing them to skip certain
5073 operations. When this flag is set for a render pass in a frame, calling
5074 \l{QRhiCommandBuffer::beginComputePass()}{beginComputePass()} in that frame
5075 may lead to unexpected behavior, depending on the resource dependencies
5076 between the render and compute passes.
5077 */
5078
5079/*!
5080 \typedef QRhiCommandBuffer::DynamicOffset
5081
5082 Synonym for QPair<int, quint32>. The first entry is the binding, the second
5083 is the offset in the buffer.
5084*/
5085
5086/*!
5087 \typedef QRhiCommandBuffer::VertexInput
5088
5089 Synonym for QPair<QRhiBuffer *, quint32>. The second entry is an offset in
5090 the buffer specified by the first.
5091*/
5092
5093/*!
5094 \internal
5095 */
5096QRhiCommandBuffer::QRhiCommandBuffer(QRhiImplementation *rhi)
5097 : QRhiResource(rhi)
5098{
5099}
5100
5101/*!
5102 \return the resource type.
5103 */
5104QRhiResource::Type QRhiCommandBuffer::resourceType() const
5105{
5106 return CommandBuffer;
5107}
5108
5109static const char *resourceTypeStr(QRhiResource *res)
5110{
5111 switch (res->resourceType()) {
5112 case QRhiResource::Buffer:
5113 return "Buffer";
5114 case QRhiResource::Texture:
5115 return "Texture";
5116 case QRhiResource::Sampler:
5117 return "Sampler";
5118 case QRhiResource::RenderBuffer:
5119 return "RenderBuffer";
5120 case QRhiResource::RenderPassDescriptor:
5121 return "RenderPassDescriptor";
5122 case QRhiResource::SwapChainRenderTarget:
5123 return "SwapChainRenderTarget";
5124 case QRhiResource::TextureRenderTarget:
5125 return "TextureRenderTarget";
5126 case QRhiResource::ShaderResourceBindings:
5127 return "ShaderResourceBindings";
5128 case QRhiResource::GraphicsPipeline:
5129 return "GraphicsPipeline";
5130 case QRhiResource::SwapChain:
5131 return "SwapChain";
5132 case QRhiResource::ComputePipeline:
5133 return "ComputePipeline";
5134 case QRhiResource::CommandBuffer:
5135 return "CommandBuffer";
5136 }
5137
5138 Q_UNREACHABLE_RETURN("");
5139}
5140
5141QRhiImplementation::~QRhiImplementation()
5142{
5143 qDeleteAll(c: resUpdPool);
5144
5145 // Be nice and show something about leaked stuff. Though we may not get
5146 // this far with some backends where the allocator or the api may check
5147 // and freak out for unfreed graphics objects in the derived dtor already.
5148#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG
5149 // debug builds: just do it always
5150 static bool leakCheck = true;
5151#else
5152 // release builds: opt-in
5153 static bool leakCheck = qEnvironmentVariableIntValue(varName: "QT_RHI_LEAK_CHECK");
5154#endif
5155 if (!resources.isEmpty()) {
5156 if (leakCheck) {
5157 qWarning(msg: "QRhi %p going down with %d unreleased resources that own native graphics objects. This is not nice.",
5158 q, int(resources.size()));
5159 }
5160 for (QRhiResource *res : std::as_const(t&: resources)) {
5161 if (leakCheck)
5162 qWarning(msg: " %s resource %p (%s)", resourceTypeStr(res), res, res->m_objectName.constData());
5163
5164 // Null out the resource's rhi pointer. This is why it makes sense to do null
5165 // checks in the destroy() implementations of the various resource types. It
5166 // allows to survive in bad applications that somehow manage to destroy a
5167 // resource of a QRhi after the QRhi itself.
5168 res->m_rhi = nullptr;
5169 }
5170 }
5171}
5172
5173bool QRhiImplementation::isCompressedFormat(QRhiTexture::Format format) const
5174{
5175 return (format >= QRhiTexture::BC1 && format <= QRhiTexture::BC7)
5176 || (format >= QRhiTexture::ETC2_RGB8 && format <= QRhiTexture::ETC2_RGBA8)
5177 || (format >= QRhiTexture::ASTC_4x4 && format <= QRhiTexture::ASTC_12x12);
5178}
5179
5180void QRhiImplementation::compressedFormatInfo(QRhiTexture::Format format, const QSize &size,
5181 quint32 *bpl, quint32 *byteSize,
5182 QSize *blockDim) const
5183{
5184 int xdim = 4;
5185 int ydim = 4;
5186 quint32 blockSize = 0;
5187
5188 switch (format) {
5189 case QRhiTexture::BC1:
5190 blockSize = 8;
5191 break;
5192 case QRhiTexture::BC2:
5193 blockSize = 16;
5194 break;
5195 case QRhiTexture::BC3:
5196 blockSize = 16;
5197 break;
5198 case QRhiTexture::BC4:
5199 blockSize = 8;
5200 break;
5201 case QRhiTexture::BC5:
5202 blockSize = 16;
5203 break;
5204 case QRhiTexture::BC6H:
5205 blockSize = 16;
5206 break;
5207 case QRhiTexture::BC7:
5208 blockSize = 16;
5209 break;
5210
5211 case QRhiTexture::ETC2_RGB8:
5212 blockSize = 8;
5213 break;
5214 case QRhiTexture::ETC2_RGB8A1:
5215 blockSize = 8;
5216 break;
5217 case QRhiTexture::ETC2_RGBA8:
5218 blockSize = 16;
5219 break;
5220
5221 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_4x4:
5222 blockSize = 16;
5223 break;
5224 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_5x4:
5225 blockSize = 16;
5226 xdim = 5;
5227 break;
5228 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_5x5:
5229 blockSize = 16;
5230 xdim = ydim = 5;
5231 break;
5232 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_6x5:
5233 blockSize = 16;
5234 xdim = 6;
5235 ydim = 5;
5236 break;
5237 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_6x6:
5238 blockSize = 16;
5239 xdim = ydim = 6;
5240 break;
5241 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_8x5:
5242 blockSize = 16;
5243 xdim = 8;
5244 ydim = 5;
5245 break;
5246 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_8x6:
5247 blockSize = 16;
5248 xdim = 8;
5249 ydim = 6;
5250 break;
5251 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_8x8:
5252 blockSize = 16;
5253 xdim = ydim = 8;
5254 break;
5255 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_10x5:
5256 blockSize = 16;
5257 xdim = 10;
5258 ydim = 5;
5259 break;
5260 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_10x6:
5261 blockSize = 16;
5262 xdim = 10;
5263 ydim = 6;
5264 break;
5265 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_10x8:
5266 blockSize = 16;
5267 xdim = 10;
5268 ydim = 8;
5269 break;
5270 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_10x10:
5271 blockSize = 16;
5272 xdim = ydim = 10;
5273 break;
5274 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_12x10:
5275 blockSize = 16;
5276 xdim = 12;
5277 ydim = 10;
5278 break;
5279 case QRhiTexture::ASTC_12x12:
5280 blockSize = 16;
5281 xdim = ydim = 12;
5282 break;
5283
5284 default:
5285 Q_UNREACHABLE();
5286 break;
5287 }
5288
5289 const quint32 wblocks = uint((size.width() + xdim - 1) / xdim);
5290 const quint32 hblocks = uint((size.height() + ydim - 1) / ydim);
5291
5292 if (bpl)
5293 *bpl = wblocks * blockSize;
5294 if (byteSize)
5295 *byteSize = wblocks * hblocks * blockSize;
5296 if (blockDim)
5297 *blockDim = QSize(xdim, ydim);
5298}
5299
5300void QRhiImplementation::textureFormatInfo(QRhiTexture::Format format, const QSize &size,
5301 quint32 *bpl, quint32 *byteSize, quint32 *bytesPerPixel) const
5302{
5303 if (isCompressedFormat(format)) {
5304 compressedFormatInfo(format, size, bpl, byteSize, blockDim: nullptr);
5305 return;
5306 }
5307
5308 quint32 bpc = 0;
5309 switch (format) {
5310 case QRhiTexture::RGBA8:
5311 bpc = 4;
5312 break;
5313 case QRhiTexture::BGRA8:
5314 bpc = 4;
5315 break;
5316 case QRhiTexture::R8:
5317 bpc = 1;
5318 break;
5319 case QRhiTexture::RG8:
5320 bpc = 2;
5321 break;
5322 case QRhiTexture::R16:
5323 bpc = 2;
5324 break;
5325 case QRhiTexture::RG16:
5326 bpc = 4;
5327 break;
5328 case QRhiTexture::RED_OR_ALPHA8:
5329 bpc = 1;
5330 break;
5331
5332 case QRhiTexture::RGBA16F:
5333 bpc = 8;
5334 break;
5335 case QRhiTexture::RGBA32F:
5336 bpc = 16;
5337 break;
5338 case QRhiTexture::R16F:
5339 bpc = 2;
5340 break;
5341 case QRhiTexture::R32F:
5342 bpc = 4;
5343 break;
5344
5345 case QRhiTexture::RGB10A2:
5346 bpc = 4;
5347 break;
5348
5349 case QRhiTexture::D16:
5350 bpc = 2;
5351 break;
5352 case QRhiTexture::D24:
5353 case QRhiTexture::D24S8:
5354 case QRhiTexture::D32F:
5355 bpc = 4;
5356 break;
5357
5358 default:
5359 Q_UNREACHABLE();
5360 break;
5361 }
5362
5363 if (bpl)
5364 *bpl = uint(size.width()) * bpc;
5365 if (byteSize)
5366 *byteSize = uint(size.width() * size.height()) * bpc;
5367 if (bytesPerPixel)
5368 *bytesPerPixel = bpc;
5369}
5370
5371bool QRhiImplementation::sanityCheckGraphicsPipeline(QRhiGraphicsPipeline *ps)
5372{
5373 if (ps->cbeginShaderStages() == ps->cendShaderStages()) {
5374 qWarning(msg: "Cannot build a graphics pipeline without any stages");
5375 return false;
5376 }
5377
5378 bool hasVertexStage = false;
5379 for (auto it = ps->cbeginShaderStages(), itEnd = ps->cendShaderStages(); it != itEnd; ++it) {
5380 if (!it->shader().isValid()) {
5381 qWarning(msg: "Empty shader passed to graphics pipeline");
5382 return false;
5383 }
5384 if (it->type() == QRhiShaderStage::Vertex)
5385 hasVertexStage = true;
5386 }
5387 if (!hasVertexStage) {
5388 qWarning(msg: "Cannot build a graphics pipeline without a vertex stage");
5389 return false;
5390 }
5391
5392 if (!ps->renderPassDescriptor()) {
5393 qWarning(msg: "Cannot build a graphics pipeline without a QRhiRenderPassDescriptor");
5394 return false;
5395 }
5396
5397 if (!ps->shaderResourceBindings()) {
5398 qWarning(msg: "Cannot build a graphics pipeline without QRhiShaderResourceBindings");
5399 return false;
5400 }
5401
5402 return true;
5403}
5404
5405bool QRhiImplementation::sanityCheckShaderResourceBindings(QRhiShaderResourceBindings *srb)
5406{
5407#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG
5408 bool bindingsOk = true;
5409 const int CHECKED_BINDINGS_COUNT = 64;
5410 bool bindingSeen[CHECKED_BINDINGS_COUNT] = {};
5411 for (auto it = srb->cbeginBindings(), end = srb->cendBindings(); it != end; ++it) {
5412 const int binding = it->data()->binding;
5413 if (binding >= CHECKED_BINDINGS_COUNT)
5414 continue;
5415 if (binding < 0) {
5416 qWarning("Invalid binding number %d", binding);
5417 bindingsOk = false;
5418 continue;
5419 }
5420 switch (it->data()->type) {
5421 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::UniformBuffer:
5422 if (!bindingSeen[binding]) {
5423 bindingSeen[binding] = true;
5424 } else {
5425 qWarning("Uniform buffer duplicates an existing binding number %d", binding);
5426 bindingsOk = false;
5427 }
5428 break;
5429 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::SampledTexture:
5430 if (!bindingSeen[binding]) {
5431 bindingSeen[binding] = true;
5432 } else {
5433 qWarning("Combined image sampler duplicates an existing binding number %d", binding);
5434 bindingsOk = false;
5435 }
5436 break;
5437 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Texture:
5438 if (!bindingSeen[binding]) {
5439 bindingSeen[binding] = true;
5440 } else {
5441 qWarning("Texture duplicates an existing binding number %d", binding);
5442 bindingsOk = false;
5443 }
5444 break;
5445 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::Sampler:
5446 if (!bindingSeen[binding]) {
5447 bindingSeen[binding] = true;
5448 } else {
5449 qWarning("Sampler duplicates an existing binding number %d", binding);
5450 bindingsOk = false;
5451 }
5452 break;
5453 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoad:
5454 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageStore:
5455 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::ImageLoadStore:
5456 if (!bindingSeen[binding]) {
5457 bindingSeen[binding] = true;
5458 } else {
5459 qWarning("Image duplicates an existing binding number %d", binding);
5460 bindingsOk = false;
5461 }
5462 break;
5463 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoad:
5464 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferStore:
5465 case QRhiShaderResourceBinding::BufferLoadStore:
5466 if (!bindingSeen[binding]) {
5467 bindingSeen[binding] = true;
5468 } else {
5469 qWarning("Buffer duplicates an existing binding number %d", binding);
5470 bindingsOk = false;
5471 }
5472 break;
5473 default:
5474 qWarning("Unknown binding type %d", int(it->data()->type));
5475 bindingsOk = false;
5476 break;
5477 }
5478 }
5479
5480 if (!bindingsOk) {
5481 qWarning() << *srb;
5482 return false;
5483 }
5484#else
5485 Q_UNUSED(srb);
5486#endif
5487 return true;
5488}
5489
5490/*!
5491 \internal
5492 */
5493QRhi::QRhi()
5494{
5495}
5496
5497/*!
5498 Destructor. Destroys the backend and releases resources.
5499 */
5500QRhi::~QRhi()
5501{
5502 if (!d)
5503 return;
5504
5505 qDeleteAll(c: d->pendingDeleteResources);
5506 d->pendingDeleteResources.clear();
5507
5508 runCleanup();
5509
5510 d->destroy();
5511 delete d;
5512}
5513
5514/*!
5515 \return a new QRhi instance with a backend for the graphics API specified
5516 by \a impl with the specified \a flags.
5517
5518 \a params must point to an instance of one of the backend-specific
5519 subclasses of QRhiInitParams, such as, QRhiVulkanInitParams,
5520 QRhiMetalInitParams, QRhiD3D11InitParams, QRhiGles2InitParams. See these
5521 classes for examples on creating a QRhi.
5522
5523 QRhi by design does not implement any fallback logic: if the specified API
5524 cannot be initialized, create() will fail, with warnings printed on the
5525 debug output by the backends. The clients of QRhi, for example Qt Quick,
5526 may however provide additional logic that allow falling back to an API
5527 different than what was requested, depending on the platform. If the
5528 intention is just to test if initialization would succeed when calling
5529 create() at later point, it is preferable to use probe() instead of
5530 create(), because with some backends probing can be implemented in a more
5531 lightweight manner as opposed to create(), which performs full
5532 initialization of the infrastructure and is wasteful if that QRhi instance
5533 is then thrown immediately away.
5534
5535 \sa probe()
5536 */
5537QRhi *QRhi::create(Implementation impl, QRhiInitParams *params, Flags flags, QRhiNativeHandles *importDevice)
5538{
5539 std::unique_ptr<QRhi> r(new QRhi);
5540
5541 switch (impl) {
5542 case Null:
5543 r->d = new QRhiNull(static_cast<QRhiNullInitParams *>(params));
5544 break;
5545 case Vulkan:
5546#if QT_CONFIG(vulkan)
5547 r->d = new QRhiVulkan(static_cast<QRhiVulkanInitParams *>(params),
5548 static_cast<QRhiVulkanNativeHandles *>(importDevice));
5549 break;
5550#else
5551 Q_UNUSED(importDevice);
5552 qWarning(msg: "This build of Qt has no Vulkan support");
5553 break;
5554#endif
5555 case OpenGLES2:
5556#ifndef QT_NO_OPENGL
5557 r->d = new QRhiGles2(static_cast<QRhiGles2InitParams *>(params),
5558 static_cast<QRhiGles2NativeHandles *>(importDevice));
5559 break;
5560#else
5561 qWarning("This build of Qt has no OpenGL support");
5562 break;
5563#endif
5564 case D3D11:
5565#ifdef Q_OS_WIN
5566 r->d = new QRhiD3D11(static_cast<QRhiD3D11InitParams *>(params),
5567 static_cast<QRhiD3D11NativeHandles *>(importDevice));
5568 break;
5569#else
5570 qWarning(msg: "This platform has no Direct3D 11 support");
5571 break;
5572#endif
5573 case Metal:
5574#if defined(Q_OS_MACOS) || defined(Q_OS_IOS)
5575 r->d = new QRhiMetal(static_cast<QRhiMetalInitParams *>(params),
5576 static_cast<QRhiMetalNativeHandles *>(importDevice));
5577 break;
5578#else
5579 qWarning(msg: "This platform has no Metal support");
5580 break;
5581#endif
5582 }
5583
5584 if (r->d) {
5585 r->d->q = r.get();
5586
5587 // Play nice with QSG_INFO since that is still the most commonly used
5588 // way to get graphics info printed from Qt Quick apps, and the Quick
5589 // scenegraph is our primary user.
5590 if (qEnvironmentVariableIsSet(varName: "QSG_INFO"))
5591 const_cast<QLoggingCategory &>(QRHI_LOG_INFO()).setEnabled(type: QtDebugMsg, enable: true);
5592
5593 r->d->debugMarkers = flags.testFlag(flag: EnableDebugMarkers);
5594
5595 if (r->d->create(flags)) {
5596 r->d->implType = impl;
5597 r->d->implThread = QThread::currentThread();
5598 return r.release();
5599 }
5600 }
5601
5602 return nullptr;
5603}
5604
5605/*!
5606 \return true if create() can be expected to succeed when called the given
5607 \a impl and \a params.
5608
5609 For some backends this is equivalent to calling create(), checking its
5610 return value, and then destroying the resulting QRhi.
5611
5612 For others, in particular with Metal, there may be a specific probing
5613 implementation, which allows testing in a more lightweight manner without
5614 polluting the debug output with warnings upon failures.
5615
5616 \sa create()
5617 */
5618bool QRhi::probe(QRhi::Implementation impl, QRhiInitParams *params)
5619{
5620 bool ok = false;
5621
5622 // The only place currently where this makes sense is Metal, where the API
5623 // is simple enough so that a special probing function - doing nothing but
5624 // a MTLCreateSystemDefaultDevice - is reasonable. Elsewhere, just call
5625 // create() and then drop the result.
5626
5627 if (impl == Metal) {
5628#if defined(Q_OS_MACOS) || defined(Q_OS_IOS)
5629 ok = QRhiMetal::probe(static_cast<QRhiMetalInitParams *>(params));
5630#endif
5631 } else {
5632 QRhi *rhi = create(impl, params);
5633 ok = rhi != nullptr;
5634 delete rhi;
5635 }
5636 return ok;
5637}
5638
5639/*!
5640 \struct QRhiSwapChainProxyData
5641 \internal
5642 \inmodule QtGui
5643 */
5644
5645/*!
5646 Generates and returns a QRhiSwapChainProxyData struct containing opaque
5647 data specific to the backend and graphics API specified by \a impl. \a
5648 window is the QWindow a swapchain is targeting.
5649
5650 The returned struct can be passed to QRhiSwapChain::setProxyData(). This
5651 makes sense in threaded rendering systems: this static function is expected
5652 to be called on the \b{main (gui) thread}, unlike all QRhi operations, then
5653 transferred to the thread working with the QRhi and QRhiSwapChain and passed
5654 on to the swapchain. This allows doing native platform queries that are
5655 only safe to be called on the main thread, for example to query the
5656 CAMetalLayer from a NSView, and then passing on the data to the
5657 QRhiSwapChain living on the rendering thread. With the Metal example, doing
5658 the view.layer access on a dedicated rendering thread causes a warning in
5659 the Xcode Thread Checker. With the data proxy mechanism, this is avoided.
5660
5661 When threads are not involved, generating and passing on the
5662 QRhiSwapChainProxyData is not required: backends are guaranteed to be able
5663 to query whatever is needed on their own, and if everything lives on the
5664 main (gui) thread, that should be sufficient.
5665
5666 \note \a impl should match what the QRhi is created with. For example,
5667 calling with QRhi::Metal on a non-Apple platform will not generate any
5668 useful data.
5669 */
5670QRhiSwapChainProxyData QRhi::updateSwapChainProxyData(QRhi::Implementation impl, QWindow *window)
5671{
5672#if defined(Q_OS_MACOS) || defined(Q_OS_IOS)
5673 if (impl == Metal)
5674 return QRhiMetal::updateSwapChainProxyData(window);
5675#else
5676 Q_UNUSED(impl);
5677 Q_UNUSED(window);
5678#endif
5679 return {};
5680}
5681
5682/*!
5683 \return the backend type for this QRhi.
5684 */
5685QRhi::Implementation QRhi::backend() const
5686{
5687 return d->implType;
5688}
5689
5690/*!
5691 \return a friendly name for the backend \a impl, usually the name of the 3D
5692 API in use.
5693 */
5694const char *QRhi::backendName(Implementation impl)
5695{
5696 switch (impl) {
5697 case QRhi::Null:
5698 return "Null";
5699 case QRhi::Vulkan:
5700 return "Vulkan";
5701 case QRhi::OpenGLES2:
5702 return "OpenGL";
5703 case QRhi::D3D11:
5704 return "D3D11";
5705 case QRhi::Metal:
5706 return "Metal";
5707 }
5708
5709 Q_UNREACHABLE_RETURN("Unknown");
5710}
5711
5712/*!
5713 \return the backend type as string for this QRhi.
5714 */
5715const char *QRhi::backendName() const
5716{
5717 return backendName(impl: d->implType);
5718}
5719
5720/*!
5721 \enum QRhiDriverInfo::DeviceType
5722 Specifies the graphics device's type, when the information is available. In
5723 practice this is only applicable with Vulkan and Metal. With others the
5724 value will always be UnknownDevice.
5725
5726 \value UnknownDevice
5727 \value IntegratedDevice
5728 \value DiscreteDevice
5729 \value ExternalDevice
5730 \value VirtualDevice
5731 \value CpuDevice
5732*/
5733
5734/*!
5735 \struct QRhiDriverInfo
5736 \internal
5737 \inmodule QtGui
5738 \since 6.1
5739
5740 \brief Describes the physical device, adapter, or graphics API
5741 implementation that is used by an initialized QRhi.
5742
5743 Graphics APIs offer different levels and kinds of information. The only
5744 value that is available across all APIs is the deviceName, which is a
5745 freetext description of the physical device, adapter, or is a combination
5746 of the strings reported for \c{GL_VENDOR} + \c{GL_RENDERER} +
5747 \c{GL_VERSION}. The deviceId is always 0 for OpenGL. vendorId is always 0
5748 for OpenGL and Metal. deviceType is always UnknownDevice for OpenGL and
5749 Direct 3D.
5750 */
5751
5752#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
5753static inline const char *deviceTypeStr(QRhiDriverInfo::DeviceType type)
5754{
5755 switch (type) {
5756 case QRhiDriverInfo::UnknownDevice:
5757 return "Unknown";
5758 case QRhiDriverInfo::IntegratedDevice:
5759 return "Integrated";
5760 case QRhiDriverInfo::DiscreteDevice:
5761 return "Discrete";
5762 case QRhiDriverInfo::ExternalDevice:
5763 return "External";
5764 case QRhiDriverInfo::VirtualDevice:
5765 return "Virtual";
5766 case QRhiDriverInfo::CpuDevice:
5767 return "Cpu";
5768 }
5769
5770 Q_UNREACHABLE_RETURN(nullptr);
5771}
5772QDebug operator<<(QDebug dbg, const QRhiDriverInfo &info)
5773{
5774 QDebugStateSaver saver(dbg);
5775 dbg.nospace() << "QRhiDriverInfo(deviceName=" << info.deviceName
5776 << " deviceId=0x" << Qt::hex << info.deviceId
5777 << " vendorId=0x" << info.vendorId
5778 << " deviceType=" << deviceTypeStr(type: info.deviceType)
5779 << ')';
5780 return dbg;
5781}
5782#endif
5783
5784/*!
5785 \return metadata for the graphics device used by this successfully
5786 initialized QRhi instance.
5787 */
5788QRhiDriverInfo QRhi::driverInfo() const
5789{
5790 return d->driverInfo();
5791}
5792
5793/*!
5794 \return the thread on which the QRhi was \l{QRhi::create()}{initialized}.
5795 */
5796QThread *QRhi::thread() const
5797{
5798 return d->implThread;
5799}
5800
5801/*!
5802 Registers a \a callback that is invoked either when the QRhi is destroyed,
5803 or when runCleanup() is called.
5804
5805 The callback will run with the graphics resource still available, so this
5806 provides an opportunity for the application to cleanly release QRhiResource
5807 instances belonging to the QRhi. This is particularly useful for managing
5808 the lifetime of resources stored in \c cache type of objects, where the
5809 cache holds QRhiResources or objects containing QRhiResources.
5810
5811 \sa runCleanup(), ~QRhi()
5812 */
5813void QRhi::addCleanupCallback(const CleanupCallback &callback)
5814{
5815 d->addCleanupCallback(callback);
5816}
5817
5818/*!
5819 Invokes all registered cleanup functions. The list of cleanup callbacks it
5820 then cleared. Normally destroying the QRhi does this automatically, but
5821 sometimes it can be useful to trigger cleanup in order to release all
5822 cached, non-essential resources.
5823
5824 \sa addCleanupCallback()
5825 */
5826void QRhi::runCleanup()
5827{
5828 for (const CleanupCallback &f : std::as_const(t&: d->cleanupCallbacks))
5829 f(this);
5830
5831 d->cleanupCallbacks.clear();
5832}
5833
5834/*!
5835 Registers a \a callback that is called with an elapsed time calculated from
5836 GPU timestamps asynchronously after a timestamp becomes available at some
5837 point after presenting a frame.
5838
5839 The callback is called with a float value that is meant to be in
5840 milliseconds and represents the elapsed time on the GPU side for a given
5841 frame. Care must be exercised with the interpretation of the value, as what
5842 it exactly is is not controlled by Qt and depends on the underlying
5843 graphics API and its implementation. In particular, comparing the values
5844 between different graphics APIs is discouraged and may be meaningless.
5845
5846 The timing values become available asynchronously, sometimes several frames
5847 after the frame has been submitted in endFrame(). There is currently no way
5848 to identify the frame. The callback is invoked whenever the timestamp
5849 queries complete.
5850
5851 \note This is only supported when the Timestamp feature is reported as
5852 supported from isFeatureSupported(). Otherwise the \a callback is never
5853 called.
5854
5855 The \a callback is always called on the thread the QRhi lives and operates
5856 on. While not guaranteed, it is typical that the callback is invoked from
5857 within beginFrame().
5858 */
5859void QRhi::addGpuFrameTimeCallback(const GpuFrameTimeCallback &callback)
5860{
5861 d->addGpuFrameTimeCallback(callback);
5862}
5863
5864/*!
5865 \class QRhiResourceUpdateBatch
5866 \internal
5867 \inmodule QtGui
5868 \brief Records upload and copy type of operations.
5869
5870 With QRhi it is no longer possible to perform copy type of operations at
5871 arbitrary times. Instead, all such operations are recorded into batches
5872 that are then passed, most commonly, to QRhiCommandBuffer::beginPass().
5873 What then happens under the hood is hidden from the application: the
5874 underlying implementations can defer and implement these operations in
5875 various different ways.
5876
5877 A resource update batch owns no graphics resources and does not perform any
5878 actual operations on its own. It should rather be viewed as a command
5879 buffer for update, upload, and copy type of commands.
5880
5881 To get an available, empty batch from the pool, call
5882 QRhi::nextResourceUpdateBatch().
5883 */
5884
5885/*!
5886 \internal
5887 */
5888QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::QRhiResourceUpdateBatch(QRhiImplementation *rhi)
5889 : d(new QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate)
5890{
5891 d->q = this;
5892 d->rhi = rhi;
5893}
5894
5895QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::~QRhiResourceUpdateBatch()
5896{
5897 delete d;
5898}
5899
5900/*!
5901 \return the batch to the pool. This should only be used when the batch is
5902 not passed to one of QRhiCommandBuffer::beginPass(),
5903 QRhiCommandBuffer::endPass(), or QRhiCommandBuffer::resourceUpdate()
5904 because these implicitly call destroy().
5905
5906 \note QRhiResourceUpdateBatch instances must never by \c deleted by
5907 applications.
5908 */
5909void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::release()
5910{
5911 d->free();
5912}
5913
5914/*!
5915 Copies all queued operations from the \a other batch into this one.
5916
5917 \note \a other may no longer contain valid data after the merge operation,
5918 and must not be submitted, but it will still need to be released by calling
5919 release().
5920
5921 This allows for a convenient pattern where resource updates that are
5922 already known during the initialization step are collected into a batch
5923 that is then merged into another when starting to first render pass later
5924 on:
5925
5926 \badcode
5927 void init()
5928 {
5929 ...
5930 initialUpdates = rhi->nextResourceUpdateBatch();
5931 initialUpdates->uploadStaticBuffer(vbuf, vertexData);
5932 initialUpdates->uploadStaticBuffer(ibuf, indexData);
5933 ...
5934 }
5935
5936 void render()
5937 {
5938 ...
5939 QRhiResourceUpdateBatch *resUpdates = rhi->nextResourceUpdateBatch();
5940 if (initialUpdates) {
5941 resUpdates->merge(initialUpdates);
5942 initialUpdates->release();
5943 initialUpdates = nullptr;
5944 }
5945 resUpdates->updateDynamicBuffer(...);
5946 ...
5947 cb->beginPass(rt, clearCol, clearDs, resUpdates);
5948 }
5949 \endcode
5950 */
5951void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::merge(QRhiResourceUpdateBatch *other)
5952{
5953 d->merge(other: other->d);
5954}
5955
5956/*!
5957 \return true until the number of buffer and texture operations enqueued
5958 onto this batch is below a reasonable limit.
5959
5960 The return value is false when the number of buffer and/or texture
5961 operations added to this batch have reached, or are about to reach, a
5962 certain limit. The batch is fully functional afterwards as well, but may
5963 need to allocate additional memory. Therefore, a renderer that collects
5964 lots of buffer and texture updates in a single batch when preparing a frame
5965 may want to consider \l{QRhiCommandBuffer::resourceUpdate()}{submitting the
5966 batch} and \l{QRhi::nextResourceUpdateBatch()}{starting a new one} when
5967 this function returns false.
5968 */
5969bool QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::hasOptimalCapacity() const
5970{
5971 return d->hasOptimalCapacity();
5972}
5973
5974/*!
5975 Enqueues updating a region of a QRhiBuffer \a buf created with the type
5976 QRhiBuffer::Dynamic.
5977
5978 The region is specified \a offset and \a size. The actual bytes to write
5979 are specified by \a data which must have at least \a size bytes available.
5980 \a data can safely be destroyed or changed once this function returns.
5981
5982 \note If host writes are involved, which is the case with
5983 updateDynamicBuffer() typically as such buffers are backed by host visible
5984 memory with most backends, they may accumulate within a frame. Thus pass 1
5985 reading a region changed by a batch passed to pass 2 may see the changes
5986 specified in pass 2's update batch.
5987
5988 \note QRhi transparently manages double buffering in order to prevent
5989 stalling the graphics pipeline. The fact that a QRhiBuffer may have
5990 multiple native underneath can be safely ignored when using the QRhi and
5991 QRhiResourceUpdateBatch.
5992 */
5993void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::updateDynamicBuffer(QRhiBuffer *buf, quint32 offset, quint32 size, const void *data)
5994{
5995 if (size > 0) {
5996 const int idx = d->activeBufferOpCount++;
5997 const int opListSize = d->bufferOps.size();
5998 if (idx < opListSize)
5999 QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::changeToDynamicUpdate(op: &d->bufferOps[idx], buf, offset, size, data);
6000 else
6001 d->bufferOps.append(t: QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::dynamicUpdate(buf, offset, size, data));
6002 }
6003}
6004
6005/*!
6006 Enqueues updating a region of a QRhiBuffer \a buf created with the type
6007 QRhiBuffer::Immutable or QRhiBuffer::Static.
6008
6009 The region is specified \a offset and \a size. The actual bytes to write
6010 are specified by \a data which must have at least \a size bytes available.
6011 \a data can safely be destroyed or changed once this function returns.
6012 */
6013void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::uploadStaticBuffer(QRhiBuffer *buf, quint32 offset, quint32 size, const void *data)
6014{
6015 if (size > 0) {
6016 const int idx = d->activeBufferOpCount++;
6017 if (idx < d->bufferOps.size())
6018 QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::changeToStaticUpload(op: &d->bufferOps[idx], buf, offset, size, data);
6019 else
6020 d->bufferOps.append(t: QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::staticUpload(buf, offset, size, data));
6021 }
6022}
6023
6024/*!
6025 Enqueues updating the entire QRhiBuffer \a buf created with the type
6026 QRhiBuffer::Immutable or QRhiBuffer::Static.
6027 */
6028void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::uploadStaticBuffer(QRhiBuffer *buf, const void *data)
6029{
6030 if (buf->size() > 0) {
6031 const int idx = d->activeBufferOpCount++;
6032 if (idx < d->bufferOps.size())
6033 QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::changeToStaticUpload(op: &d->bufferOps[idx], buf, offset: 0, size: 0, data);
6034 else
6035 d->bufferOps.append(t: QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::staticUpload(buf, offset: 0, size: 0, data));
6036 }
6037}
6038
6039/*!
6040 Enqueues reading back a region of the QRhiBuffer \a buf. The size of the
6041 region is specified by \a size in bytes, \a offset is the offset in bytes
6042 to start reading from.
6043
6044 A readback is asynchronous. \a result contains a callback that is invoked
6045 when the operation has completed. The data is provided in
6046 QRhiBufferReadbackResult::data. Upon successful completion that QByteArray
6047 will have a size equal to \a size. On failure the QByteArray will be empty.
6048
6049 \note Reading buffers with a usage different than QRhiBuffer::UniformBuffer
6050 is supported only when the QRhi::ReadBackNonUniformBuffer feature is
6051 reported as supported.
6052
6053 \note The asynchronous readback is guaranteed to have completed when one of
6054 the following conditions is met: \l{QRhi::finish()}{finish()} has been
6055 called; or, at least \c N frames have been \l{QRhi::endFrame()}{submitted},
6056 including the frame that issued the readback operation, and the
6057 \l{QRhi::beginFrame()}{recording of a new frame} has been started, where \c
6058 N is the \l{QRhi::resourceLimit()}{resource limit value} returned for
6059 QRhi::MaxAsyncReadbackFrames.
6060
6061 \sa readBackTexture(), QRhi::isFeatureSupported(), QRhi::resourceLimit()
6062 */
6063void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::readBackBuffer(QRhiBuffer *buf, quint32 offset, quint32 size, QRhiBufferReadbackResult *result)
6064{
6065 const int idx = d->activeBufferOpCount++;
6066 if (idx < d->bufferOps.size())
6067 d->bufferOps[idx] = QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::read(buf, offset, size, result);
6068 else
6069 d->bufferOps.append(t: QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::BufferOp::read(buf, offset, size, result));
6070}
6071
6072/*!
6073 Enqueues uploading the image data for one or more mip levels in one or more
6074 layers of the texture \a tex.
6075
6076 The details of the copy (source QImage or compressed texture data, regions,
6077 target layers and levels) are described in \a desc.
6078 */
6079void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::uploadTexture(QRhiTexture *tex, const QRhiTextureUploadDescription &desc)
6080{
6081 if (desc.cbeginEntries() != desc.cendEntries()) {
6082 const int idx = d->activeTextureOpCount++;
6083 if (idx < d->textureOps.size())
6084 d->textureOps[idx] = QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::TextureOp::upload(tex, desc);
6085 else
6086 d->textureOps.append(t: QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::TextureOp::upload(tex, desc));
6087 }
6088}
6089
6090/*!
6091 Enqueues uploading the image data for mip level 0 of layer 0 of the texture
6092 \a tex.
6093
6094 \a tex must have an uncompressed format. Its format must also be compatible
6095 with the QImage::format() of \a image. The source data is given in \a
6096 image.
6097 */
6098void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::uploadTexture(QRhiTexture *tex, const QImage &image)
6099{
6100 uploadTexture(tex,
6101 desc: QRhiTextureUploadEntry(0, 0, QRhiTextureSubresourceUploadDescription(image)));
6102}
6103
6104/*!
6105 Enqueues a texture-to-texture copy operation from \a src into \a dst as
6106 described by \a desc.
6107
6108 \note The source texture \a src must be created with
6109 QRhiTexture::UsedAsTransferSource.
6110
6111 \note The format of the textures must match. With most graphics
6112 APIs the data is copied as-is without any format conversions. If
6113 \a dst and \a src are created with different formats, unspecified
6114 issues may arise.
6115 */
6116void QRhiResourceUpdateBatch::copyTexture(QRhiTexture *dst, QRhiTexture *src, const QRhiTextureCopyDescription &desc)
6117{
6118 const int idx = d->activeTextureOpCount++;
6119 if (idx < d->textureOps.size())
6120 d->textureOps[idx] = QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::TextureOp::copy(dst, src, desc);
6121 else
6122 d->textureOps.append(t: QRhiResourceUpdateBatchPrivate::TextureOp::copy(dst, src, desc));
6123}
6124
6125/*!
6126 Enqueues a texture-to-host copy operation as described by \a rb.
6127
6128 Normally \a rb will specify a QRhiTexture as the source. However, when the
6129 swapchain in the current frame was created with
6130 QRhiSwapChain::UsedAsTransferSource, it can also be the source of the
6131 readback. For this, leave the texture set to null in \a rb.
6132
6133 Unlike other operations, the results here need to be processed by the
6134 application. Therefore, \a result provides not just the data but also a
6135 callback as operations on the batch are asynchronous by nature:
6136
6137 \badcode
6138 beginFrame(sc);
6139 beginPass
6140 ...
6141 QRhiReadbackResult *rbResult = new QRhiReadbackResult;
6142 rbResult->completed = [rbResult] {
6143 {
6144 const QImage::Format fmt = QImage::Format_RGBA8888_Premultiplied; // fits QRhiTexture::RGBA8
